spearheaded by masterminded by
songwriter singer keyboardist

dropped in 2009 and off of this album
some of the best pop singles of the
aughts came like quicksand and

while I still hear on the radio to this

modern pop song with in an age where

that I was with the record itself that I
was the deeper cuts but I was looking
forward to whatever LaRue was doing in
the future because there was a lot of
talent on this record I thought
Jackson's voice was great I like the

vintage 80s synth-pop flair to a totally
new wave yet there was something really
modern and punchy about the electro
style production now my anticipation of
this new record has been heightened by a

essentially had to wait about five years
to hear this record - we have the loss
of Ben Lang made as an official member

until this point and then some really
great singles
I think builds up to the release of this

downtown keep in mind I haven't heard
anything single wise on this album that
I think is going to have the staying
power and the virality of bulletproof
but I still think La Rue brings our
really great no-frills pop album with
nine songs to the table the rhythms the

essentially tell a series of tales of
the highs and the lows of love the song
paradise is you is essentially about
being obsessed and infatuated with that
one
special person and seeing literally
paradise in being with that person or
there's cruel sexuality which seems to

Jackson is singing you make me happy in

in this prison at night and then there's

singing about this guy who seems to be
pursuing sex with strangers or even
insinuating sex with prostitutes over
having sex with his significant other
Jackson is definitely in the same mental
state when it comes to the world of love

you're kind of out of luck outside of

which have a very blissful nostalgic

Jackson is sounding more inspired by 80s

there are beats on this record that

pop vibe
and it feels old enough to be a little
